This guide is a simplified overview of all the changes in the [[Texture Update]] ({{BE}} 1.10.x releases), which assumes at least some familiarity with ''Bedrock Edition'' 1.9.0.

== Mobs ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Mobs}} 
|-
| [[Cat]]
| [[File:Jellie Cat.png|128px]]
| Added a new variant: Jellie, the community cat contest winner.
| {{Drop|Item|String|0|2}} 
|
|-
| [[Illager beast]]
| [[File:Ravager.png|128px]]
| N/A
| {{Drop|Item|Saddle|1}} 
| Illager beasts currently only have the basic AI.
|-
| [[Wandering trader]] 
| [[File:Wandering Trader.png|128px]]
| Appears at a [[village]]'s gathering site periodically and stays for a period of 2–3 in-game days (40–60 minutes of real-life time).
|
{{Drop|Item|Potion of Invisibility|8.5%}}
|
* Wandering traders are accompanied by two custom llamas.
* Wandering traders are available through Experimental Gameplay.
|}

=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Mobs}} 
|-
| [[Creeper]]
| [[File:Creeper_JE3_BE1.png|128px]]
| Now have a chance to drop a [[music disc]] when killed by a [[stray]], as well as a [[skeleton]].
|-
| [[Pillager]]
| [[File:Pillager_BE1.png|128px]]
|
* Are no longer only available through Experimental Gameplay.
* Added new sounds.
|-
| [[Villager]]
| [[File:Plains_Villager_Base_JE2.png|128px]]
|
* Have been split into two mobs:
** New villagers spawn in new villages.
*** Available through Experimental Gameplay.
** Old villagers still spawn in igloo basements.
|}

=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Blocks}}
|-
| [[Campfire]] 
| {{animate|Campfire JE1 BE1.png;Unlit Campfire JE1 BE1.png|84px}}
|
{{Crafting
|B1= Stick
|A2= Stick
|B2= Coal; Charcoal

| Silk touch, axe breaks fastest.
|

|-
| [[Composter]]
| [[File:Composter.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting|A1= Any Wooden Slab|A2= Any Wooden Slab|C1= Any Wooden Slab|C2= Any Wooden Slab|A3 = Any Wooden Slab|B3 = Any Wooden Slab|C3 = Any Wooden Slab|Output=Composter}}
| Axe
|
* Composters have no functionality.
* Composters are available through Experimental Gameplay.
|-
| [[Jigsaw block]] 
| [[File:Jigsaw Block JE1 BE1.png|84px]] 
| Can only be obtained via an inventory editor.
| N/A
| Jigsaw blocks have no functionality.
|-
| [[Lectern]]
| [[File:Lectern.png|84px]]
| Lecterns generate naturally as part of libraries in villages.
{{Crafting|A1=Any Wooden Slab|B1=Any Wooden Slab|C1=Any Wooden Slab|B2=Bookshelf|B3=Any Wooden Slab|Output=Lectern}}
| Lecterns can be broken with any tool as well as by hand, with axes being the fastest tool to use.
|
* Placing a book and quill or written book on the lectern allows multiple players to read it together.
* A book and quill can be read, but not edited when placed on a lectern.
|-
| [[Loom]]
| [[File:Loom JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting|B2=String|C2=String|B3=Any Planks|C3=Any Planks|Output=Loom}}
| Looms can be broken with any tool as well as by hand, with axes being the fastest tool to use.
| Looms are used to easily make patterns for banners.
|-
| [[Stonecutter]]
| [[File:Stonecutter.gif|84px]]
| Available through Experimental Gameplay.
| Stonecutters can be mined with any pickaxe.
| Stone cutters have no functionality.
|-
| [[Sweet berry bush]]es
| {{animate|Sweet Berry Bush Age 0 JE1 BE1.png;Sweet Berry Bush Age 1 JE1 BE1.png;Sweet Berry Bush Age 2 JE1 BE1.png;Sweet Berry Bush Age 3 JE1 BE1.png|84px}}
|
* Sweet berry bushes can be found naturally in all taiga variants.
* Sweet berry bushes can be planted with [[sweet berries]].
| Sweet berry bushes can be broken with any tool as well as by hand.
|
* Sweet berry bushes drop sweet berries by {{control|using}} or when broken, dropping 1-2 berries at age three, and 2-3 berries at age four.
* Sweet berry bushes slow players while standing in them at age one, as well as deal damage to players while moving at age two and above. Standing still while in sweet berry bushes will deal no damage.
|}

== Items ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Items}} 
|-
| [[Banner pattern]]
| [[File:Banner Pattern JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting|Paper|Enchanted Golden Apple;Wither Skeleton Skull;Creeper Head;Oxeye Daisy|Output=Thing Banner Pattern; Skull Charge Banner Pattern; Creeper Charge Banner Pattern; Flower Charge Banner Pattern|ingredients=[[Paper]] + Chosen Design Item}}
|
* Banner patterns can be used in a [[loom]] to apply the chosen pattern to that banner.
* The globe banner pattern cannot be crafted, and is only obtainable from master-level cartographer villagers.
|-
| [[Black dye]]
| [[File:Black Dye JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting|B2=Ink Sac;Wither Rose|Output=Black Dye|shapeless=true}}
| Black dye is used in place of ink sacs as dye in all recipes.
|-
| [[Sweet berries]]
| [[File:Sweet Berries JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
| Sweet berries can be harvested from [[sweet berry bush]]es. Additionally sweet berries can be found in taiga village house chests.
|
* Sweet berries give {{hunger|2}} hunger points when eaten.
* Sweet berries can be {{control|used}} on grass blocks, dirt, podzol, coarse dirt, and farmland to plant a sweet berry bush sapling.
* Sweet berries are used to breed [[foxes]].
|-
|[[Spawn egg]]<br>([[Ravager|Illager beast]]/[[Wandering trader]])
|{{animate|Ravager Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png;Wandering Trader Spawn Egg BE1.png|84px}}
| Can be obtained only via creative inventory. 
|
* Has the same function as other [[spawn egg]].
* Available through Experimental Gameplay.
|}

| [[File:Pillager outpost main.png|278px|center]]

|

* [[Iron golem]]s
|
